metadata.description: The name of the Bot Service to configure
The name for the OAuth connection setting
The Azure AD Application (client) ID from the app registration
The Azure AD Application ID URI (e.g., api://botid-{guid})
The federated credential subject (unique identifier from the federated credential)
OAuth scopes to request - should be the app ID URI with access_as_user scope
The tenant ID for the Azure AD application

connectionId.value: [resourceId('Microsoft.BotService/botServices/connections', split(format('{0}/{1}', parameters('botServiceName'), parameters('connectionName')), '/')[0], split(format('{0}/{1}', parameters('botServiceName'), parameters('connectionName')), '/')[1])]

settingId.value: [reference(resourceId('Microsoft.BotService/botServices/connections', split(format('{0}/{1}', parameters('botServiceName'), parameters('connectionName')), '/')[0], split(format('{0}/{1}', parameters('botServiceName'), parameters('connectionName')), '/')[1]), '2022-09-15').settingId]

provisioningState.value: [reference(resourceId('Microsoft.BotService/botServices/connections', split(format('{0}/{1}', parameters('botServiceName'), parameters('connectionName')), '/')[0], split(format('{0}/{1}', parameters('botServiceName'), parameters('connectionName')), '/')[1]), '2022-09-15').provisioningState]
